title: Exploitation of the multitarget role of new ferulic and gallic acid derivatives in oxidative stress-related Alzheimer's disease therapies: design, synthesis and bioevaluation
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,10304-10321
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA00766B, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Fahad Hussain, Ayesha Tahir, Muhammad Saeed Jan, Noor Fatima, Abdul Sadiq, Umer Rashid
Monoamine oxidases (MAOs) inhibitors could decrease reactive oxygen species (ROS) generation, enhance mono-aminergic neural transmission, and have major therapeutic benefits for the treatment of Alzheimer's disease (AD).
